medical_history.chief_complaint: Behavioral problems and learning disabilities in a 12-year-old boy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with behavioral problems and headaches; MR imaging in July 2001 revealed a mesencephalic arteriovenous malformation (AVM) with dilation of the vein of Galen. The AVM was asymptomatic, and no treatment was proposed at first. In February 2003, moderate hepatic dysfunction (slight hyperammonemia) was diagnosed.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was born at full term via cesarean section and walked at 14 months. His twin brother had similar behavioral problems. No other relevant medical history provided.
medical_history.family_history: The twin brother exhibited similar behavioral problems, although to a lesser degree.
